name: Adnan Darwiche
content: Adnan Darwiche Adnan Darwiche 368B Engineering 6 Computer Science Department University of California Los Angeles, CA 90095-1596 lastname@cs.ucla.edu Adnan Darwiche is a professor and former chairman of the computer science department at UCLA. He holds M.S. (1989) and Ph.D. (1993) degrees in computer science from Stanford University. Received an honorary doctorate (docteur honoris causa) from the University of Artois, France, in 2022. Served as Editor-in-Chief for the Journal of Artificial Intelligence Research (JAIR). Received the Lockheed Martin Excellence in Teaching Award. Fellow of AAAI, ACM and AAIA. Professor Darwiche directs the Automated Reasoning Group at UCLA. His research interests span probabilistic reasoning, symbolic reasoning and machine learning. For publications and software, click here. For online talks and tutorials (YouTube Channel), click here. For a position paper on Artificial Intelligence that appeared in CACM, click here. For information on his book "Modeling and Reasoning with Bayesian Networks," click here. For a review article on Bayesian Networks that appeared in CACM, click here. For the Beyond NP effort he initiated, click here. Beyond Truth and Falsehood: Logic as a Caclulus of Events World Logic Day Lecture, Vienna 2024 Human-Level Intelligence or Animal-Like Abilities? Communications of the ACM, October, 2018 Honorary Doctorate Ceremony (Docteur Honoris Causa) University of Artois, France, 2022
